company.name: Watershed Development Corp.
company.address: 28835 N. Herky Drive, Unit 106, Lake Bluff, Illinois 60044
company.business_description: Watershed Development Corp. is a franchisee of Aaron's, Inc. that operates eight rent-to-own stores in Illinois. The company rents consumer goods such as furniture, household appliances, and consumer electronics including computers, with an option for consumers to purchase the rented items.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Watershed Development Corporation, a rent-to-own franchisee operating eight stores in Illinois, installed software called PC Rental Agent on rented computers that enabled secret surveillance of consumers. Using the Detective Mode feature, Watershed surreptitiously monitored computer users by logging keystrokes, taking screenshots, and capturing webcam images, thereby obtaining sensitive personal information including usernames, passwords, and financial account access credentials. Watershed also deployed fake software registration windows to trick consumers into providing contact information, which was then used for debt collection purposes.

representations_made.description: Displayed fake software registration windows that appeared to be from Microsoft Windows or other trusted software providers requiring consumers to enter contact information to continue using the software
representations_made.quoted_text: respondent has represented or caused to be represented to consumers, expressly or by implication, that certain pop-up notices that appear on computer screens are notices from trusted software providers that contain software registration forms that must be filled out with the consumers' contact information in order to continue to use the providers' software.

counts.title: Unfair Gathering of Consumers' Personal Information
counts.representation: Respondent installed monitoring software on rented computers and gathered sensitive personal information about consumers from those computers
counts.fact: This gathering of private and confidential information causes or is likely to cause substantial harm to consumers who are at risk from exposure of personal, financial, and medical information and suffer unwarranted invasion into their homes and lives, which consumers cannot reasonably avoid because Detective Mode is invisible to them
counts.conclusion: Respondent's actions cause or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that cannot be reasonably avoided and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition. Therefore, respondent's practices constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act.

counts.title: Unfair Collection Practices
counts.representation: Respondent used information improperly gathered from consumers to collect or attempt to collect a debt, money, or property pursuant to a consumer rental contract
counts.fact: This use of improperly gathered information for debt collection purposes causes or is likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that cannot be reasonably avoided and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Respondent's actions cause or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that cannot be reasonably avoided and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition. Therefore, respondent's practices constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act.

counts.title: Deceptive Gathering of Consumers' Personal Information
counts.representation: Respondent represented that certain pop-up notices appearing on computer screens are notices from trusted software providers containing software registration forms that must be filled out with contact information to continue using the providers' software
counts.fact: In truth and in fact, these pop-up notices are not from trusted software providers and do not contain software registration forms that must be filled out to continue using the providers' software, but instead serve only to cause the consumer to provide requested contact information so that respondent can use this information in connection with collecting or attempting to collect debts, money, or property pursuant to consumer rental contracts
counts.conclusion: Therefore, respondent's practices constitute deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act.

definitions.respondent: Watershed and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: shall be defined as it is defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.
definitions.Computer: any desktop or laptop computer, handheld device, tablet, telephone, or other electronic product or device that has a platform on which to download, install, or run any software program, code, script, or other content.
definitions.Clear(ly) and prominent(ly): a. In textual communications (e.g., printed publications or words displayed on the screen of a computer or mobile device), the required disclosures are of a type, size, and location sufficiently noticeable for an ordinary consumer to read and comprehend them, in print that contrasts highly with the background on which they appear; b. In communications disseminated orally or through audible means (e.g., radio or streaming audio), the required disclosures are delivered in a volume and cadence sufficient for an ordinary consumer to hear and comprehend them; c. In communications disseminated through video means (e.g., television or streaming video), the required disclosures are in writing in a form consistent with subpart (a) of this definition and shall appear on the screen for a duration sufficient for an ordinary consumer to read and comprehend them, and in the same language as the predominant language that is used in the communication; d. In communications made through interactive media, such as the Internet, online services, and software, the required disclosures are unavoidable and presented in a form consistent with subpart (a) of this definition, in addition to any audio or video presentation of them; and e. In all instances, the required disclosures are presented in an understandable language and syntax; in the same language as the predominant language that is used in the communication; and include nothing contrary to, inconsistent with, or in mitigation of any statement contained within the disclosure or within any document linked to or referenced therein.
definitions.Geophysical location tracking technology: any hardware, software, or application utilized in conjunction with a computer that collects and reports data or information that identifies the precise geophysical location of the computer. Geophysical location tracking technologies include, for these purposes, technologies that report: the GPS coordinates of a computer; the WiFi signals available to or actually used by a computer to access the Internet; the telecommunication towers or connections available to or actually used by a computer; the processing of any such reported data through geolocation lookup services; or any information derived from any combination of the foregoing.
definitions.Monitoring technology: any hardware, software, or application utilized in conjunction with a computer that can cause the computer to (1) capture, monitor, or record, and (2) report information about user activities by: a. Recording keystrokes, clicks, or other user-generated actions; b. Capturing screenshots of the information displayed on a computer monitor or screen; or c. Activating the camera or microphone function of a computer to take photographs or record audio or visual content through the computer's webcam or microphone.
definitions.Covered rent-to-own transaction: any transaction where a consumer enters into an agreement for the purchase or rental of a computer and the consumer's contract or rental agreement provides for payments over time and an option to purchase the computer.

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information from computers rented to consumers in covered rent-to-own transactions.

requirements.description: Must not use monitoring technology to gather information from rented computers
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that respondent, directly or through any corporation, partnership, subsidiary, division, trade name, or other device, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with it who receive actual notice of this order, by personal service or otherwise, in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer.

provisions.title: Use of Tracking Technology Limited
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide clear and prominent notice and obtain affirmative express consent before using geophysical location tracking technology, and must display a clear icon when such technology is active.

requirements.description: Must not gather information via geophysical location tracking technology without clear notice and affirmative express consent
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, directly or through any corporation, partnership, subsidiary, division, trade name, or other device, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with it who receive actual notice of this order, by personal service or otherwise, in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from: A. Gathering any information or data from any computer via any geophysical location tracking technology without providing clear and prominent notice to the computer user at the time the computer is rented and immediately prior to each use of the geophysical location tracking technology, and also obtaining affirmative express consent from the computer's renter at the time the computer is rented;

requirements.description: Must not install or activate geophysical location tracking technology that does not provide clear and prominent notice immediately prior to each use
requirements.quoted_text: B. Installing or activating on rented computers geophysical location tracking technology where that technology does not provide clear and prominent notice to the computer user immediately prior to each use of the geophysical location tracking technology;

requirements.description: Must provide clear and prominent notice separate from privacy policies that discloses tracking technology, types of activity captured, entities with whom data is shared, purposes, and contact information
requirements.quoted_text: 1. Clear and Prominent Notice: respondent shall provide a clear and prominent notice to the user, separate and apart from any "privacy policy," "data use policy," "terms of service," "end-user license agreement," "lease agreement," or other similar document, that discloses (1) that geophysical location tracking technology is installed and/or currently running on the computer; (2) the types of user activity or conduct that is being captured by such technology; (3) the identities or specific categories of entities with whom any data or information that is collected will be shared or otherwise provided; (4) the purpose(s) for the collection, use, or sharing of such data or information; and (5) where and how the user can contact someone for additional information.

requirements.description: Must obtain affirmative express consent by giving an equally clear choice to agree or not agree, with neither option highlighted or preselected as default
requirements.quoted_text: 2. Affirmative Express Consent: respondent shall obtain affirmative express consent by giving the computer renter an equally clear and prominent choice to either agree or not agree to any geophysical location tracking technology, and neither option may be highlighted or preselected as a default setting. Activation of any geophysical location tracking technology must not proceed until the computer's renter provides affirmative express consent.

requirements.description: Must provide a clear and prominent icon on the computer desktop and system tray that, when clicked, discloses tracking information
requirements.quoted_text: 3. Icons: respondent shall provide that the activation of any geophysical location tracking technology be accompanied by the installation of a clear and prominent icon on the computer on which the technology is installed, such as on the desktop and in the desktop system tray of the computer. Clicking on the icon must clearly and prominently disclose: (1) that geophysical location tracking technology is installed and currently running on the computer; (2) the types of user activity or conduct that is being captured by such technology; (3) the identities or specific categories of entities with whom any data or information that is collected will be shared or otherwise provided; (4) the purpose(s) for the collection, use, or sharing of such data or information; and (5) where and how the user can contact someone for additional information.

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making false representations or deceptions in any notice or software application that results in gathering information from consumers.

requirements.description: Must not make false representations in any notice or software application that results in gathering consumer information
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, directly or through any corporation, partnership, subsidiary, division, trade name, or other device, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with it who receive actual notice of this order, by personal service or otherwise, in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from making or causing to be made any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or other software application appearing on the screen of any computer that results in gathering information from or about a consumer, including without limitation location information.

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from using information obtained in violation of Parts I, II, and III for debt collection purposes.

requirements.description: Must not use information obtained in noncompliance with Parts I, II, and III to collect debts
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, directly or through any corporation, partnership, subsidiary, division, trade name, or other device, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with it who receive actual notice of this order, by personal service or otherwise, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from using, in connection with collecting or attempting to collect a debt, money, or property pursuant to a covered rent-to-own transaction, any information or data obtained in a manner that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order.

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all user data previously gathered using noncompliant monitoring or tracking technology and must encrypt data during transmission.

requirements.description: Must delete or destroy all user data previously gathered using monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III
requirements.quoted_text: A. Delete or destroy all user data previously gathered using any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order;

requirements.description: Must render data unreadable, unusable, or indecipherable during transmission from computer to respondent's servers and between servers
requirements.quoted_text: B. Transfer data or information gathered by any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology from the computer upon which the technology is installed to respondent's server(s), and from the respondent's server(s) to any other computers or servers only if the information collected is rendered unreadable, unusable, or indecipherable during transmission.

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of personal information.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent the security, privacy, or confidentiality protections for personal information collected from consumers
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, directly or through any corporation, partnership, subsidiary, division, trade name, or other device, and its officers, agents, servants, employees, and all persons or entities in active concert or participation with it who receive actual notice of this order, by personal service or otherwise, in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction shall not misrepresent, in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of any personal information collected from or about consumers.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers with related responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Must deliver a copy of order to current personnel within seven days after service
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers who have responsibilities related to the subject matter of this order. Delivery must occur within seven days after the date of service of the order for current personnel.

requirements.description: Must deliver a copy of order to new personnel before they assume their responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: For new personnel, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Must obtain signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from each individual who receives a copy of the order
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual to whom respondent delivers a copy of this Order, respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order, with any electronic signatures complying with the requirements of the E-Sign Act, 15 U.S.C. § 7001 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission within 60 days and as otherwise required, and must notify the Commission of corporate changes at least 30 days in advance.

requirements.description: Must file a true and accurate compliance report within sixty days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, and its successors and assigns, shall, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require, file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which they have complied with this order.

requirements.description: Must submit additional written reports within ten days of receipt of written notice from the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, respondent shall submit additional true and accurate written reports.

requirements.description: Must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any corporate change affecting compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent, and its successors and assigns, shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to, dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or related entity that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain documents related to compliance with the order for five years and make them available to the FTC upon reasonable notice.

requirements.description: Must maintain for five years all documents related to complaints or inquiries concerning monitoring or geophysical tracking technologies
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall, for five (5) years after the last date of any act or practice covered by Parts I – VI of this Order, maintain and upon reasonable notice make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that: A. Comprise or relate to complaints or inquiries, whether received directly, indirectly, or through any third party, concerning any monitoring or geophysical tracking technologies sold, licensed, or otherwise provided to any third party, and any responses to those complaints or inquiries;

requirements.description: Must maintain for five years all documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: B. Are reasonably necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this order, including but not limited to, all documents obtained, created, generated, or which in any way relate to the requirements, provisions, or terms of this order, and all reports submitted to the Commission pursuant to this order;

requirements.description: Must maintain for five years all documents that contradict, qualify, or call into question compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: C. Contradict, qualify, or call into question respondent's compliance with this order;

requirements.description: Must maintain for five years all acknowledgments of receipt of the order
requirements.quoted_text: D. Acknowledge receipt of this order obtained pursuant to Part VII.

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on the specified date or twenty years from most recent complaint filing
requirements.quoted_text: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Part in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Part in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
